p.k: In 2010, all six Tchaikovsky Symphonies with Valery Gergiev conducting the Mariinsky Orchestra were recorded at Salle Pleyel in Paris. This concert features the First Symphony of this great Russian composer.
p.d: The Russian composer Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky wrote his first symphony in 1866. Symphony No. 1, also known as Winter Daydreams, was his first notable work. According to colleagues and family members this first symphony was a real struggle for Tchaikovsky, but it became a beautiful work that has been recorded by a lot of famous orchestras and conductors. This concert features the Mariinsky Orchestra and conductor Valery Gergiev at the Salle Pleyel in Paris. In 2010, all six Tchaikovsky symphonies were recorded by this Russian combination.
